attributes.action: Provide protection to Afghan women fleeing the Taliban
attributes.background:
The U.K. government should: 

Increase the amount of visas issued, even to women without passports. 

Provide routes for women trying to flee and pressure international powers to provide protection to women being abused by the Taliban. 

Refuse to legitimise the power of the Taliban.

rejection.details:
The Home Office announced on 18 August 2021 a bespoke resettlement route for Afghan refugees who have been forced to flee the country. You can read more about it on the gov.uk website: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/bespoke-resettlement-route-for-afghan-refugees-announced

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help the people of Afghanistan: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594723

Redeploy UK Forces to Afghanistan to protect the citizens against the Taliban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594823
